item.title: Trump Wants Europe to Defend Itself. Here’s What It Would Take.
item.description: Replacing what the Americans do for the NATO alliance would take money, personnel, time and cooperation. None of those are easy.

item.title: As Catholics Gather for Jubilee, Just One Thing Is Missing: Francis
item.description: For the faithful who have descended on Rome for an event that comes every 25 years, the absence of the pope has been especially deeply felt.

item.title: Atherstone Ball Game Continues an 826-Year-Old Tradition in England
item.description: In the 826-year-old Atherstone Ball Game, there are two rules, locals say: Keep the big leather ball on the main street, and don’t kill anyone.

item.title: Players Tussle in English Town’s Centuries-Old Football Game
item.description: The Atherstone Ball Game, a tradition since 1199 in the town of Atherstone, England, is one of a dwindling number of folk football games played across...

item.title: How Trump’s ’51st State’ Canada Talk Came to Be Seen as Deadly Serious
item.description: President Trump, in an early February call, challenged the border treaty between the two countries and told Justin Trudeau he didn’t like their shared...
